page.title: 08Transport in the area.
page.content: The roads in the area are usually fairly quiet, with the exception of the Andover to Salisbury road (A343). The majority of people own a car; in fact a survey showed that over 40% of the people we asked owned two or more cars. Nearly 60% of these cars were less than three years old. The villages are served by three different bus routes which pass through the area. These are operated by Hampshire Bus and Wilts and Dorset which are part of the National Bus Company. Approximately 35% of the people we asked use the bus services at some time, usually for shopping trips. There are no train services in the area. The nearest railway station is at Andover.
